description: E-Commerce Application Metrics Dashboard - SigNoz Format
title: E-Commerce Metrics Dashboard

widgets.description: Total number of HTTP requests received by the e-commerce application. This metric provides an overview of application traffic volume. Monitor for sudden spikes or drops which may indicate issues or traffic patterns. High values indicate high user activity, while sudden drops may signal service degradation.

clickhouse_sql.name: total_requests
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    sum(delta) AS total_requests
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        max(s.value) - min(s.value) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
      AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY s.fingerprint
)

widgets.title: Total Requests

widgets.description: Percentage of HTTP requests that resulted in errors (4xx or 5xx status codes). Critical metric for application health. Values above 1% indicate potential issues requiring investigation. Monitor trends to identify error patterns and correlate with deployment times or traffic spikes.

clickhouse_sql.name: error_rate
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AS start_ms,
    {{.end_timestamp_ms}}   AS end_ms

SELECT
    if(
        sum(total_delta) > 0,
        (sum(err_delta) / sum(total_delta)) * 100,
        0
    ) AS error_rate_percent
FROM
(
    SELECT
        greatest(0, max(s.value) - min(s.value)) AS delta,
        JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'http.status_code') AS status_code,
        -- classify inside this level
        greatest(
            0,
            if(toInt32OrNull(JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'http.status_code')) >= 400, max(s.value) - min(s.value), 0)
        ) AS err_delta,
        greatest(0, max(s.value) - min(s.value)) AS total_delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN start_ms AND end_ms
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY
        s.fingerprint,
        status_code
);

widgets.title: Error Rate (%)

widgets.description: Average response time for all HTTP requests in milliseconds. Measures overall application performance. Values below 100ms are excellent, 100-300ms is good, above 500ms may indicate performance issues. Use this to track performance degradation over time.

clickhouse_sql.name: avg_latency
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    if(
        sum(delta_count) = 0,
        0,
        (sum(delta_sum) / sum(delta_count)) * 1000
    ) AS avg_latency_ms
FROM
(
    SELECT
        greatest(0, sum_delta)  AS delta_sum,
        greatest(0, count_delta) AS delta_count
    FROM
    (
        SELECT
            ts.fingerprint,

            -- sum delta per time series
            s_sum.value
              - lagInFrame(s_sum.value, 1, s_sum.value)
                    OVER (PARTITION BY ts.fingerprint ORDER BY s_sum.unix_milli)
                AS sum_delta,

            -- count delta per time series
            s_cnt.value
              - lagInFrame(s_cnt.value, 1, s_cnt.value)
                    OVER (PARTITION BY ts.fingerprint ORDER BY s_cnt.unix_milli)
                AS count_delta

        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 s_sum
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 ts USING (fingerprint)
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 s_cnt
            ON s_cnt.fingerprint = s_sum.fingerprint
           AND s_cnt.unix_milli   = s_sum.unix_milli

        WHERE
            s_sum.metric_name = 'http.server.request.duration.sum'
            AND s_cnt.metric_name = 'http.server.request.duration.count'
            AND s_sum.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
            AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    )
)

widgets.title: Avg Latency (ms)

widgets.description: 95th percentile latency - 95% of requests complete within this time. Important for understanding user experience as it represents the typical worst-case scenario. Values should be monitored relative to average latency. Spikes here indicate performance bottlenecks affecting most users.

clickhouse_sql.name: p95_latency
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    ts,
    quantileTDigestWeighted(0.95)(le_num, bucket_count) AS p95_ms
FROM
(
    SELECT
        toStartOfInterval(
            toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
            toIntervalSecond(60)
        ) AS ts,

        toFloat64OrNull(JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'le')) AS le_num,

        /* counter â†’ delta (no rate), non-negative, UInt64 */
        toUInt64(
            greatest(
                0,
                s.value
                - lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                    OVER (PARTITION BY s.fingerprint, JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'le')
                          ORDER BY s.unix_milli)
            )
        ) AS bucket_count

    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING(fingerprint)
    WHERE s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.duration.bucket'
      AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'le') != '+Inf'
)
WHERE le_num IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts

widgets.title: P95 Latency (ms)

widgets.description: 99th percentile latency - 99% of requests complete within this time. Represents the slowest requests that still affect a significant portion of users. Critical for identifying tail latency issues. High p99 values indicate specific endpoints or operations causing delays.

clickhouse_sql.name: p99_latency
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    ts,
    quantileTDigestWeighted(0.99)(le_num, bucket_count) AS p99_ms
FROM
(
    SELECT
        toStartOfInterval(
            toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
            toIntervalSecond(60)
        ) AS ts,

        -- bucket upper bound as Float64 value
        toFloat64OrNull(JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'le')) AS le_num,

        -- delta of cumulative bucket counter (UInt64 weight)
        toUInt64(
            greatest(
                0,
                s.value
                - lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                    OVER (
                        PARTITION BY s.fingerprint, JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'le')
                        ORDER BY s.unix_milli
                    )
            )
        ) AS bucket_count

    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.duration.bucket'
      AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'le') != '+Inf'
)
WHERE le_num IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts

widgets.title: P99 Latency (ms)

widgets.description: Peak number of concurrent active users during the selected time period. Indicates application load and user engagement. Monitor for capacity planning and to understand traffic patterns. Sudden increases may require scaling resources.

clickhouse_sql.name: active_users
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
  sum(v) AS active_users
FROM
(
    SELECT
        max(s.value) AS v
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'active_users_count'
        AND s.unix_milli > {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
        AND s.unix_milli <= {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'session_type') = 'active'
    GROUP BY s.fingerprint
)

widgets.title: Active Users

widgets.description: Time-series visualization of request volume. Shows traffic patterns, peak hours, and trends over time. Use to identify daily/weekly patterns, traffic spikes, and correlate with business events or deployments. Helps in capacity planning and anomaly detection.

clickhouse_sql.name: requests_per_minute
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    ts,
    sum(delta) AS requests
FROM
(
    SELECT
        toStartOfInterval(
            toDateTime(intDiv(unix_milli, 1000)),
            toIntervalMinute(1)
        ) AS ts,
        greatest(
            0,
            max(value) - min(value)
        ) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4
    WHERE metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
      AND unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
      AND fingerprint IN (
            SELECT fingerprint
            FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4
            WHERE metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
              AND JSONExtractString(labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
      )
    GROUP BY fingerprint, ts
)
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts

widgets.title: Requests Over Time

widgets.description: Trend of error rate percentage over time. Critical for identifying when errors started occurring and their duration. Spikes may correlate with deployments, traffic increases, or infrastructure changes. Monitor for sustained high error rates.

clickhouse_sql.name: error_rate
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    totals.ts AS ts,
    if(
        totals.requests = 0,
        0,
        (errors.errors * 100.0) / totals.requests
    ) AS error_rate_pct
FROM
(
    /* -------- total requests per minute -------- */
    SELECT
        ts,
        sum(delta) AS requests
    FROM
    (
        SELECT
            toStartOfInterval(
                toDateTime(intDiv(unix_milli, 1000)),
                toIntervalMinute(1)
            ) AS ts,
            greatest(0, max(value) - min(value)) AS delta
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4
        WHERE metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
          AND unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
          AND fingerprint IN (
              SELECT fingerprint
              FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4
              WHERE metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
                AND JSONExtractString(labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
          )
        GROUP BY fingerprint, ts
    )
    GROUP BY ts
) AS totals
LEFT JOIN
(
    /* -------- error requests per minute -------- */
    SELECT
        ts,
        sum(delta) AS errors
    FROM
    (
        SELECT
            toStartOfInterval(
                toDateTime(intDiv(unix_milli, 1000)),
                toIntervalMinute(1)
            ) AS ts,
            greatest(0, max(value) - min(value)) AS delta
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4
        WHERE metric_name = 'http.server.request.error.count'
          AND unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
          AND fingerprint IN (
              SELECT fingerprint
              FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4
              WHERE metric_name = 'http.server.request.error.count'
                AND JSONExtractString(labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
          )
        GROUP BY fingerprint, ts
    )
    GROUP BY ts
) AS errors
ON totals.ts = errors.ts
ORDER BY ts

widgets.title: Error Rate Over Time

widgets.description: Distribution of HTTP requests by status code. Shows the breakdown of successful (2xx), client errors (4xx), and server errors (5xx). High 4xx rates indicate client-side issues (invalid requests, authentication problems). High 5xx rates indicate server-side problems requiring immediate attention.

clickhouse_sql.name: status_code
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    status_code,
    sum(delta) AS requests
FROM
(
    SELECT
        fingerprint,

        /* extract status code ONCE inside the subquery */
        JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'http.status_code') AS status_code,

        greatest(
            0,
            max(s.value) - min(s.value)
        ) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
      AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY
        fingerprint,
        status_code
)
GROUP BY status_code
ORDER BY requests DESC

widgets.title: Requests by Status Code

widgets.description: Top endpoints experiencing the most errors. Helps identify problematic API routes or pages. Focus optimization efforts on endpoints with highest error counts. May indicate bugs, missing error handling, or resource constraints in specific features.

clickhouse_sql.name: endpoint
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    route,
    sum(delta) AS errors
FROM
(
    SELECT
        fingerprint,

        /* extract endpoint route once here */
        JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'http.route') AS route,

        /* increase in counter within time range */
        greatest(
            0,
            max(s.value) - min(s.value)
        ) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.error.count'
      AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
      AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY
        fingerprint,
        route
)
GROUP BY route
ORDER BY errors DESC
LIMIT 10

widgets.title: Top Error Endpoints

widgets.description: Detailed latency metrics (P50, P90, P99, average) broken down by endpoint. Identifies slow-performing routes that need optimization. Compare endpoints to find outliers. High latency endpoints may need caching, query optimization, or architectural improvements.

clickhouse_sql.name: latency
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    route,
    sum(count) AS request_count,
    quantileTDigestWeighted(0.50)(bucket_upper, toUInt64(count)) AS p50_ms,
    quantileTDigestWeighted(0.90)(bucket_upper, toUInt64(count)) AS p90_ms,
    quantileTDigestWeighted(0.99)(bucket_upper, toUInt64(count)) AS p99_ms,
    round(
        sum(count * bucket_upper) / nullIf(sum(count), 0),
        2
    ) AS avg_ms
FROM
(
    SELECT
        route,
        bucket_upper,
        max_cumulative - lagInFrame(max_cumulative, 1, 0) OVER (PARTITION BY route ORDER BY bucket_upper) AS count
    FROM
    (
        SELECT
            JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'http.route') AS route,
            toFloat64OrNull(JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'le')) AS bucket_upper,
            max(s.value) AS max_cumulative
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
        WHERE
            s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.duration.bucket'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
            AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
            AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
            AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'http.route') != ''
            AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'le') NOT IN ('+Inf', 'inf')
        GROUP BY route, bucket_upper
    )
)
WHERE count > 0
GROUP BY route
HAVING request_count > 0
ORDER BY p99_ms DESC
LIMIT 20;

widgets.title: Endpoint Latencies

widgets.description: Requests per second (RPS) by endpoint. Measures the load each endpoint handles. High RPS endpoints may need optimization or scaling. Use for capacity planning and identifying bottlenecks. Compare with latency metrics to find high-traffic, slow endpoints.

clickhouse_sql.name: requests_per_second
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH per_route AS
(
    SELECT
        JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'http.route') AS route,

        greatest(
            0,
            max(s.value) - min(s.value)
        ) AS delta,

        (max(s.unix_milli) - min(s.unix_milli)) / 1000.0 AS seconds
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'http.server.request.count'
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
    GROUP BY route
)

SELECT
    route,
    delta / NULLIF(seconds, 0) AS rps
FROM per_route
ORDER BY rps DESC
LIMIT 20;

widgets.title: Request Throughput by Endpoint

widgets.description: Total number of database queries executed during the time period. High query counts may indicate N+1 query problems or inefficient data access patterns. Monitor trends to identify query optimization opportunities. Compare with application performance metrics.

clickhouse_sql.name: db_queries
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AS start_ms,
    {{.end_timestamp_ms}} AS end_ms

SELECT
    sum(delta) AS total_queries
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        greatest(0, max(s.value) - min(s.value)) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'db.client.queries.count'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN start_ms AND end_ms
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY s.fingerprint
);

widgets.title: DB Query Count

widgets.description: Average time taken for database queries to execute in milliseconds. Critical for application performance as slow queries directly impact user experience. Values above 100ms may indicate missing indexes, inefficient queries, or database load issues. Monitor for query optimization opportunities.

clickhouse_sql.name: db_latency
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    greatest(0,
        sumIf(s.value, s.metric_name = 'db.client.queries.duration.sum')
        /
        nullIf(sumIf(s.value, s.metric_name = 'db.client.queries.duration.count'), 0)
    ) AS avg_db_latency_ms
FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
WHERE
    s.metric_name IN (
        'db.client.queries.duration.sum',
        'db.client.queries.duration.count'
    )
    AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
    AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
    AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'

widgets.title: DB Query Latency

widgets.description: Number of active database connections currently in use. Monitor to ensure connection pool is properly sized. High values may indicate connection leaks or insufficient pool size. Low values may indicate over-provisioning. Compare with idle connections for pool efficiency.

clickhouse_sql.name: active_connections
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    toStartOfInterval(
        toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
        toIntervalSecond(60)
    ) AS ts,
    argMax(s.value, s.unix_milli) AS active_connections
FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts_series
    USING (fingerprint)
WHERE
    s.metric_name = 'mysql.threads'
    AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'kind') = 'running'
    AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts;

widgets.title: Active Connections

widgets.description: Number of idle database connections in the connection pool. Indicates pool utilization. Too many idle connections waste resources, too few may cause connection wait times. Balance with active connections to optimize pool configuration.

clickhouse_sql.name: idle_connections
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    running AS
    (
        SELECT
            toStartOfInterval(
                toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
                toIntervalSecond(60)
            ) AS ts,
            argMax(s.value, s.unix_milli) AS threads_running
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts_series USING (fingerprint)
        WHERE
            s.metric_name = 'mysql.threads'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'kind') = 'running'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
            AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        GROUP BY ts
    ),

    connected AS
    (
        SELECT
            toStartOfInterval(
                toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
                toIntervalSecond(60)
            ) AS ts,
            argMax(s.value, s.unix_milli) AS threads_connected
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts_series USING (fingerprint)
        WHERE
            s.metric_name = 'mysql.threads'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'kind') = 'connected'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
            AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        GROUP BY ts
    )

SELECT
    connected.ts AS ts,
    (threads_connected - threads_running) AS idle_connections
FROM connected
LEFT JOIN running USING (ts)
ORDER BY ts;

widgets.title: Idle Connections

widgets.description: Trend of database connection pool utilization percentage over time. Shows how efficiently the connection pool is being used. High utilization (above 80%) may require pool size increases. Low utilization may allow pool size reduction. Monitor for connection pool optimization.

clickhouse_sql.name: connection_utilization
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    running AS
    (
        SELECT
            toStartOfInterval(
                toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
                toIntervalSecond(60)
            ) AS ts,
            argMax(s.value, s.unix_milli) AS threads_running
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts_series USING (fingerprint)
        WHERE
            s.metric_name = 'mysql.threads'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'kind') = 'running'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
            AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        GROUP BY ts
    ),

    connected AS
    (
        SELECT
            toStartOfInterval(
                toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
                toIntervalSecond(60)
            ) AS ts,
            argMax(s.value, s.unix_milli) AS threads_connected
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
        INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts_series USING (fingerprint)
        WHERE
            s.metric_name = 'mysql.threads'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'kind') = 'connected'
            AND JSONExtractString(ts_series.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
            AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        GROUP BY ts
    )

SELECT
    connected.ts AS ts,
    if(
        threads_connected = 0,
        0,
        (threads_running / toFloat64(threads_connected)) * 100.0
    ) AS connection_utilization_percent
FROM connected
LEFT JOIN running USING (ts)
ORDER BY ts;

widgets.title: DB Connections Trend

widgets.description: Distribution of database operations by type (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE). Helps understand database workload patterns. High SELECT ratios indicate read-heavy workloads suitable for read replicas. High write ratios may require write optimization strategies.

clickhouse_sql.name: query_types
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'db.operation') AS query_type,
    sum(d.delta) AS queries
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        greatest(0, max(s.value) - min(s.value)) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'db.client.queries.count'
        AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
        AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY s.fingerprint
) AS d                                    -- â­ alias added here
INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts
    ON d.fingerprint = ts.fingerprint
GROUP BY query_type
ORDER BY queries DESC

widgets.title: Query Types Distribution

widgets.description: Database operations taking longer than 500ms, broken down by operation type. Identifies queries requiring optimization. High percentages indicate performance issues. Focus optimization efforts on operations with highest slow query percentages. May require indexing, query rewriting, or schema changes.

clickhouse_sql.name: slow_queries
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'db.statement') AS query,
    JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'db.operation') AS operation,
    sum(sub.count) AS total_queries,
    sumIf(sub.count, sub.bucket_ms >= 500) AS slow_queries,
    (sumIf(sub.count, sub.bucket_ms >= 500) / NULLIF(sum(sub.count), 0)) * 100 AS slow_pct
FROM
(
    SELECT
        fingerprint,
        bucket_ms,
        max_cumulative - lagInFrame(max_cumulative, 1, 0) OVER (PARTITION BY fingerprint ORDER BY bucket_ms) AS count
    FROM
    (
        SELECT
            s.fingerprint,
            toFloat64OrNull(JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'le')) AS bucket_ms,
            max(s.value) AS max_cumulative
        FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
        INNER JOIN (
            SELECT DISTINCT fingerprint, labels
            FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4
            WHERE metric_name = 'db.client.queries.duration.bucket'
              AND JSONExtractString(labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        ) AS ts USING (fingerprint)
        WHERE
            s.metric_name = 'db.client.queries.duration.bucket'
            AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
            AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
            AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'le') NOT IN ('+Inf', 'inf')
        GROUP BY s.fingerprint, bucket_ms
    )
) AS sub
INNER JOIN (
    SELECT DISTINCT fingerprint, labels
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4
    WHERE metric_name = 'db.client.queries.duration.bucket'
) AS ts USING (fingerprint)
WHERE sub.count > 0
GROUP BY query, operation
ORDER BY slow_pct DESC

widgets.title: Slow Queries

widgets.description: Total number of orders created during the selected time period. Key business metric indicating sales volume. Monitor for trends, seasonal patterns, and correlation with marketing campaigns. Sudden drops may indicate checkout issues or payment problems.

clickhouse_sql.name: orders
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AS start_ms,
    {{.end_timestamp_ms}}   AS end_ms

SELECT
    sum(delta) AS completed_orders
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        greatest(
            0,
            s.value -
            lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                OVER (PARTITION BY s.fingerprint ORDER BY s.unix_milli)
        ) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 s
    JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'orders_created_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN start_ms AND end_ms
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'order_status') = 'completed'
);

widgets.title: Total Orders

widgets.description: Total revenue generated in USD during the selected time period. Primary business performance indicator. Track trends, compare periods, and correlate with marketing activities. Monitor for revenue growth patterns and identify revenue optimization opportunities.

clickhouse_sql.name: revenue
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    sum(delta_revenue) AS revenue_added
FROM
(
    SELECT
        greatest(
            0,
            s.value
            - lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                  OVER (
                      PARTITION BY s.fingerprint
                      ORDER BY s.unix_milli
                  )
        ) AS delta_revenue
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'revenue_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels,'order_status') = 'completed'
)

widgets.title: Total Revenue (USD)

widgets.description: Number of shopping carts with items over time. Indicates potential sales opportunities. High cart counts with low order completion may indicate checkout friction. Monitor to optimize checkout flow and reduce cart abandonment.

clickhouse_sql.name: active_carts
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    toStartOfInterval(toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli,1000)), toIntervalMinute(1)) AS ts,
    anyLast(s.value) AS active_carts
FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
WHERE
    s.metric_name = 'active_carts_count'
    AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
    AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts

widgets.title: Active Carts

widgets.description: Total number of product page views over time. Indicates customer engagement and interest in products. High views with low conversions may indicate pricing or product information issues. Use to identify popular products and optimize product pages.

clickhouse_sql.name: product_views
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH buckets AS
(
    SELECT
        toStartOfInterval(
            toDateTime(intDiv(s.unix_milli, 1000)),
            toIntervalMinute(1)
        ) AS ts,
        max(s.value) AS v
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'products_viewed_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
    GROUP BY ts
)
SELECT
    ts,
    v - first_value(v) OVER (ORDER BY ts ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS product_views_since_range_start
FROM buckets
ORDER BY ts

widgets.title: Product Views

widgets.description: Current inventory level across all products. Critical for stock management and preventing stockouts. Low values may trigger restocking alerts. Monitor to ensure adequate stock levels and identify fast-moving products requiring frequent restocking.

clickhouse_sql.name: inventory
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    anyLast(s.value) AS inventory_level
FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
WHERE
    s.metric_name = 'inventory_level'
    AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
    AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
    AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'

widgets.title: Inventory Level

widgets.description: Percentage of cache requests that were served from cache vs. requiring database queries. Higher values (above 80%) indicate effective caching. Low values may indicate cache invalidation issues, insufficient cache size, or cache key problems. Monitor to optimize cache performance.

clickhouse_sql.name: cache_hit_rate
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    ifNull(
        (hits.h / nullIf(hits.h + misses.m, 0)) * 100,
        0
    ) AS cache_hit_rate_pct
FROM
(
    SELECT greatest(0, max(s.value) - min(s.value)) AS h
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'cache_hits_total'
        AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
        AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
) AS hits
CROSS JOIN
(
    SELECT greatest(0, max(s.value) - min(s.value)) AS m
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'cache_misses_total'
        AND s.unix_milli >= {{.start_timestamp_ms}}
        AND s.unix_milli <  {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(ts.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
) AS misses

widgets.title: Cache Hit Rate (%)

widgets.description: Time-series visualization of order creation over time. Shows sales trends, peak shopping hours, and seasonal patterns. Use to identify sales patterns, correlate with marketing campaigns, and plan inventory. Helps in business forecasting and capacity planning.

clickhouse_sql.name: orders_per_minute
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AS start_ms,
    {{.end_timestamp_ms}}   AS end_ms

SELECT
    toStartOfInterval(
        toDateTime(intDiv(unix_milli, 1000)),
        toIntervalMinute(1)
    ) AS ts,
    sum(delta) AS completed_orders
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        s.unix_milli,
        greatest(
            0,
            s.value -
            lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                OVER (PARTITION BY s.fingerprint ORDER BY s.unix_milli)
        ) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 s
    JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'orders_created_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN start_ms AND end_ms
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'order_status') = 'completed'
)
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts;

widgets.title: Orders Over Time

widgets.description: Time-series visualization of revenue generation over time. Critical business metric showing revenue growth trends. Identify peak revenue periods, seasonal patterns, and growth trends. Correlate with marketing activities and product launches to measure impact.

clickhouse_sql.name: revenue_per_minute
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AS start_ms,
    {{.end_timestamp_ms}}   AS end_ms

SELECT
    toStartOfInterval(
        toDateTime(intDiv(unix_milli, 1000)),
        toIntervalMinute(1)
    ) AS ts,
    sum(delta) AS revenue
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        s.unix_milli,

        greatest(
            0,
            s.value -
            lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                OVER (PARTITION BY s.fingerprint ORDER BY s.unix_milli)
        ) AS delta

    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 s
    JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'revenue_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN start_ms AND end_ms
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
)
GROUP BY ts
ORDER BY ts;

widgets.title: Revenue Over Time

widgets.description: Distribution of product views by category. Shows which product categories are most popular. Use for inventory planning, marketing focus, and product strategy. High-performing categories may need more inventory or marketing support.

clickhouse_sql.name: category
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'product_category') AS category,
    sum(d.delta) AS value
FROM
(
    SELECT
        fingerprint,
        greatest(0, max(value) - min(value)) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4
    WHERE
        metric_name = 'products_viewed_total'
        AND unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
    GROUP BY fingerprint
) AS d
INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS ts ON d.fingerprint = ts.fingerprint
WHERE JSONExtractString(ts.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
GROUP BY category
ORDER BY value DESC

widgets.title: Product Views by Category

widgets.description: Distribution of revenue by payment method (credit card, PayPal, etc.). Helps understand customer payment preferences. Use for payment processing optimization and to identify preferred payment methods. May indicate payment method availability issues if certain methods are underutilized.

clickhouse_sql.name: payment_method
clickhouse_sql.query:
SELECT
    payment_method,
    sum(delta_value) AS value_increase
FROM
(
    SELECT
        JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'payment_method') AS payment_method,

        greatest(
            0,
            s.value
            - lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                  OVER (PARTITION BY s.fingerprint ORDER BY s.unix_milli)
        ) AS delta_value
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 AS s
    INNER JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 AS t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'revenue_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AND {{.end_timestamp_ms}}
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels,'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels,'order_status') = 'completed'
)
GROUP BY payment_method
ORDER BY payment_method;

widgets.title: Revenue by Payment Method

widgets.description: Distribution of orders by status (pending, processing, shipped, delivered, cancelled). Shows order fulfillment pipeline health. High cancellation rates may indicate issues. Monitor processing times and identify bottlenecks in fulfillment workflow.

clickhouse_sql.name: orders_per_minute_by_status
clickhouse_sql.query:
WITH
    {{.start_timestamp_ms}} AS start_ms,
    {{.end_timestamp_ms}}   AS end_ms
SELECT
    toStartOfInterval(
        toDateTime(intDiv(unix_milli, 1000)),
        toIntervalMinute(1)
    ) AS ts,
    CASE
        WHEN status = '' OR status IS NULL THEN 'created'
        ELSE status
    END AS order_status,
    sum(delta) AS value
FROM
(
    SELECT
        s.fingerprint,
        s.unix_milli,
        JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'order_status') AS status,
        greatest(
            0,
            s.value
            - lagInFrame(s.value, 1, s.value)
                OVER (PARTITION BY s.fingerprint ORDER BY s.unix_milli)
        ) AS delta
    FROM signoz_metrics.distributed_samples_v4 s
    JOIN signoz_metrics.distributed_time_series_v4 t USING (fingerprint)
    WHERE
        s.metric_name = 'orders_created_total'
        AND s.unix_milli BETWEEN start_ms AND end_ms
        AND JSONExtractString(t.labels, 'service.name') = 'ecommerce-go-app'
)
GROUP BY ts, order_status
ORDER BY ts, order_status;

widgets.title: Orders by Status
